dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the biggest problem facing the world right now is definitely the pandemic, right? Everything else is kinda secondary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the biggest problem facing the world right now is definitely the pandemic, right? Everything else is kinda secondary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among the most ominous threats and challenges, beyond pandemic disease, are a rapidly changing global climate, violent conflict and large-scale displacement in fragile states, and sophisticated cyber-attacks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, actually, um, while the pandemic is huge, the article we read points to other really ominous threats too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, actually, um, while the pandemic is huge, the article we read points to other really ominous threats too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among the most ominous threats and challenges, beyond pandemic disease, are a rapidly changing global climate, violent conflict and large-scale displacement in fragile states, and sophisticated cyber-attacks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Like what? I thought it was all about global health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Like what? I thought it was all about global health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no. It's, uh, climate change, violent conflicts and large-scale displacement, and sophisticated cyber-attacks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no. It's, uh, climate change, violent conflicts and large-scale displacement, and sophisticated cyber-attacks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among the most ominous threats and challenges, beyond pandemic disease, are a rapidly changing global climate, violent conflict and large-scale displacement in fragile states, and sophisticated cyber-attacks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But... those are, like, individual country problems, aren't they? Each country can just deal with its own.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But... those are, like, individual country problems, aren't they? Each country can just deal with its own.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What these challenges have in common is that they are beyond the ability of any country to resolve on its own.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly not that. That's the core issue. No single country can, um, resolve any of these on its own.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly not that. That's the core issue. No single country can, um, resolve any of these on its own.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What these challenges have in common is that they are beyond the ability of any country to resolve on its own.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so we need international cooperation. Got it. But, like, people generally wanna do that, right? Work together?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so we need international cooperation. Got it. But, like, people generally wanna do that, right? Work together?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You'd think so, wouldn't you? But, uh, that cooperation is actually being jeopardized by a big resurgence in nationalism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You'd think so, wouldn't you? But, uh, that cooperation is actually being jeopardized by a big resurgence in nationalism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: International cooperation is crucial, but that cooperation is being jeopardized by a resurgence in nationalism which threatens the very structure of the international order built three-quarters of a century ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nationalism? Oh, like, "my country first," forget everyone else?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nationalism? Oh, like, my country first, forget everyone else?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's pretty much it. And it's a huge risk for, like, the entire UN system. It could, um, decline, decay, even collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's pretty much it. And it's a huge risk for, like, the entire U N system. It could, um, decline, decay, even collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rising nationalism raises a significant risk that the UN systems structure and institutions, essential but in need of repair and rejuvenation, may instead be left to decline, decay, and even collapse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. Collapse? But the UN's always been there, right? I mean, they prevented World War Three and stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. Collapse? But the U N's always been there, right? I mean, they prevented World War Three and stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such discussions and debates serve as a reminder that the UN system has, over the past several decades, offered lifesaving support to vulnerable people, safeguarded basic human rights, advanced sustainable development, and prevented a Third World War.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They absolutely have. The article highlights their past successes, saving lives, safeguarding rights, preventing a Third World War.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They absolutely have. The article highlights their past successes, saving lives, safeguarding rights, preventing a Third World War.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such discussions and debates serve as a reminder that the UN system has, over the past several decades, offered lifesaving support to vulnerable people, safeguarded basic human rights, advanced sustainable development, and prevented a Third World War.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So what's the plan then? Just let it fall apart?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So what's the plan then? Just let it fall apart?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. There's, um, this Coalition for Global Harmony. And calls for strengthening the UN75 Declaration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. There's, um, this Coalition for Global Harmony. And calls for strengthening the UN75 Declaration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2015, when our Commission on Global Security, Justice & Governance presented its UN70 report, Confronting the Crisis of Global Governance...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: UN75 Declaration? Is that just, like, signing a paper?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: UN75 Declaration? Is that just, like, signing a paper?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's more than that. It needs, uh, actual proposals and action plans to bolster institutional capacity, improve policy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's more than that. It needs, uh, actual proposals and action plans to bolster institutional capacity, improve policy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They should agree to augment each with carefully developed proposals and action plans to bolster institutional capacity, improve policy, and strengthen public-private partnerships, all of which will be further developed in the follow-up report from the UN Secretary-General mandated by the Declaration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, they need new ideas? Not just the same old stuff from, like, governments?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, they need new ideas? Not just the same old stuff from, like, governments?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The article stresses original ideas, even from external stakeholders. Moving complex multilateral organizations, uh, towards positive outcomes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The article stresses original ideas, even from external stakeholders. Moving complex multilateral organizations, uh, towards positive outcomes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: we know from experience that original ideas from external stakeholders can help move complex multilateral organizations toward positive-sum outcomes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, there's talk about a big summit too, right? For like, global governance?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, there's talk about a big summit too, right? For like, global governance?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, a World Summit on Inclusive Global Governance by 2023. To upgrade everything, make it fit for purpose now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, a World Summit on Inclusive Global Governance by twenty twenty three. To upgrade everything, make it fit for purpose now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also advocate a World Summit on Inclusive Global Governance, as called for in the Stimson Centers recent UN 2.0 report. To be held by September 2023, the summit would seek to upgrade and equip the global governance system to address major issues facing the international community...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's about, like, fixing the system instead of letting nationalism break it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's about, like, fixing the system instead of letting nationalism break it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. And, uh, enlightened leadership, supported by civil society, is key. To get the future we want.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. And, uh, enlightened leadership, supported by civil society, is key. To get the future we want.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Five years on, enlightened leadership is needed more than ever, supported by ideas and political pressure from civil society worldwide. By reviving cooperation to meet todays many challenges, we can ensure that the future we want, for todays younger generation and all future generations, becomes the future we get.
